column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Improve Your Gas Mileage for Free
#Text=When gas prices go up most people think more about getting better gas mileage .
#Text=Many people think that it is hard and/or expensive to improve their gas mileage .
#Text=This is simply not true .
#Text=The truth is that is it easy to improve gas mileage .
#Text=Keep reading to find out how to boost fuel mileage for free !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Keep track of your fuel mileage .
#Text=When you are at the gas station keep the receipt .
#Text=After you fill up with gas make sure to reset your trip meter to 0 .
#Text=You can calculate your fuel mileage by dividing the driven distance by the amount of fuel used .
#Text=Keep a record .
#Text=There is no way to tell how much your mileage has improved unless you keep a record .
#Text=Get in the right mindset when you drive .
#Text=Think about how much fuel you are using when you are driving .
#Text=Always keep it in your mind until you get in the habit of driving for fuel economy and not for speed .
#Text=Avoid idling .
#Text=Sometimes it is necessary but keep it to a minimum .
#Text=When you start your car in the morning do n't let it sit and idle for 10 minutes , you are using gas and getting 0 miles/kilometers per gallon !
#Text=Do n't be the first one off of the line at a stop light .
#Text=Most of the time the people who are off of the line first are also the first ones to slam on their brakes at the next stop light .
#Text=This is a huge waste of fuel .
#Text=Watch the road way ahead .
#Text=If you see the traffic light turn red or cars brake lights coming on then take your foot off the accelerator and let your car coast .
#Text=By doing this you are using the momentum that you already have ( from using gas to get your car up to speed ) to get to the next stopping place .
#Text=Drive slower .
#Text=Your car is most efficient around .
#Text=After that you are wasting fuel .
#Text=Drive as close to as possible when it is appropriate .
#Text=Take the route that is the shortest and has fewer stop lights .
#Text=The longer you are driving and the more you are sitting at stop lights the more fuel you are using .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Have a goal .
#Text=If your goal is to get 15 % better gas mileage then you will be more likely to get there .
#Text=Think about how much money you are saving by driving differently .
#Text=This will help you justify it .
#Text=Try not to be in a big hurry when you drive .
#Text=If you can drive slower and think about how much fuel you are using you will be able to save more .
#Text=Drive a car that gets good mileage .
#Text=Some people have multiple cars and like driving one over the other for various reasons , but it might be worth it to use the one that gets better mileage .
